summary.elevator_pitch: Biostatistician with 8 years of experience in clinical trial design, causal inference, and machine learning applications in healthcare. Track record of developing novel statistical methods that have been adopted by pharmaceutical teams for Phase II-III trials.

education.institution: Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health
education.thesis_title: Adaptive Enrichment Designs for Subgroup-Specific Treatment Effects in Oncology Trials

experience.title: Senior Biostatistician
responsibilities: Lead statistical design for 3 concurrent Phase III oncology trials
Mentor team of 4 junior biostatisticians on adaptive trial methodology
Review and approve statistical analysis plans across therapeutic areas
accomplishments: Developed adaptive enrichment design that reduced required sample size by 22% for the BEACON-3 trial
Built internal R package for Bayesian subgroup analysis used by 15 statisticians across 3 departments
Implemented group sequential monitoring framework that saved $2.3M by enabling early efficacy stopping
Co-authored company guidance on estimand framework adoption aligned with ICH E9(R1)

experience.title: Biostatistician II
responsibilities: Designed and analyzed Phase I-II dose-finding studies in immuno-oncology
Collaborated with clinicians to develop patient-reported outcome instruments
Conducted sample size calculations and power analyses for grant proposals
accomplishments: Published novel Bayesian dose-optimization method in Statistics in Medicine (2020)
Contributed to 5 successful NIH R01 grant applications totaling $8.7M in funding
Created automated reporting pipeline in R that reduced analysis turnaround from 2 weeks to 3 days
Developed competing risks survival model for treatment discontinuation prediction with AUC of 0.84

experience.title: Research Assistant
experience.organization: Harvard T.H. Chan School of Public Health
responsibilities: Conducted simulation studies for adaptive enrichment trial designs
Assisted in teaching graduate biostatistics courses
accomplishments: Developed R simulation framework for evaluating Type I error control in adaptive enrichment designs
Won department award for teaching excellence in Biostatistics 201
Presented thesis work at Joint Statistical Meetings 2017

experience.title: Statistical Consultant
responsibilities: Provided statistical consulting for cystic fibrosis trial program
accomplishments: Designed group sequential boundary for pivotal CF trial that maintained 90% power with 18% fewer patients
Delivered 12 statistical consultation reports for cross-functional teams

publications.title: Adaptive Enrichment Designs with Biomarker Subgroups: Balancing Type I Error and Power
publications.summary: Proposed a family of adaptive enrichment designs that control familywise Type I error while maintaining power for subgroup-specific effects.

publications.title: Bayesian Dose-Optimization in Immuno-Oncology: A Practical Framework
publications.summary: Developed a Bayesian dose-optimization framework incorporating both efficacy and toxicity endpoints for immuno-oncology trials.

publications.title: Competing Risks Models for Treatment Discontinuation in Oncology
publications.summary: Applied Fine-Gray competing risks models to predict treatment discontinuation patterns.

publications.title: Estimand Framework in Practice: Lessons from Oncology Trials
publications.summary: Practical guide to implementing the ICH E9(R1) estimand framework in oncology trial protocols.

presentations.title: Adaptive Enrichment Designs for Precision Oncology
Bayesian Dose-Optimization: From Theory to Practice

custom_answers.why_biostatistics: I was drawn to biostatistics because it sits at the intersection of rigorous mathematical theory and direct patient impact. Designing clinical trials means the statistical methods I develop directly influence treatment decisions.
custom_answers.management_experience: I currently mentor 4 junior biostatisticians at Sanofi, guiding their technical development and reviewing their statistical analysis plans. While not a formal management role, I have direct responsibility for their professional growth and work quality.
